elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the ECO report "Corona pandemic interrupts supply chains" (SRF 1, 8.2.2021).

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Why were the supply chains interrupted?
elements.correctAnswer: Lockdowns were imposed in numerous countries to contain the coronavirus pandemic. Production facilities in China, an important export country, were closed.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Why did container prices rise?
elements.correctAnswer: Following the resumption of production in China, demand is greater than supply and greater than transport capacity. There is a shortage of containers or the containers are not in Asia where they are needed. Shipping companies are increasing the prices for containers. The law of supply and demand applies.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the ECO report "Corona pandemic interrupts supply chains" (SRF 1, 8.2.2021).

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Show what effect this has on the prices of products in Switzerland.
elements.correctAnswer: The higher transportation costs are passed on to consumers by the companies involved, i.e. the products become more expensive.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Why are goods sent around the world?
elements.correctAnswer: In the past, transportation costs were very low. It is often much cheaper to produce goods in a low-wage country and pay for transportation than to manufacture the goods locally.
